definitions: To cause (something) to become thoroughly soaked with liquid so that no more can be absorbed.
To fill (something or someone) with a large amount of something, often to the point of excess.
To cause (a substance) to reach its maximum concentration in a solution.
To fill (a market or area) with a product or service to the point where demand is met or exceeded.
examples: The rain will saturate the soil.
They plan to saturate the market with their new product.
The sponge was saturated with water.
His mind was saturated with details.
